column2: This time series represents the Gold and Foreign Exchange Position over a period of time published by the South African Reserve Bank and updated at the end of each month.
The Rand values would not agree with the exchange rate due to system change during the month of April 2016
Figures might not add up due to rounding.
The Minister of Finance has on 6 March 2005, after consultation with the South African Reserve Bank (“SARB”), under section 25(1) of the South African Reserve Bank Act, 1989 (Act No. 90 of 1989),
determined that, for statutory price purposes, all gold  of the SARB be valued at the market prices taken at 14h30 on each valuation date.
